name: SupportInnesAndLarachel
_source: speak;Larachel;Yes...|You know, I believe this is our first chance to speak privately.|I am L'Arachel of the Theocracy of Rausten.|It's a pleasure to meet you.
speak;Innes;I believe you already know my name.|I am Innes, prince of Frelia.
speak;Larachel;Speaking of Frelia...|Oh, I remember, the seafood was delicious there.
speak;Innes;Yes.|I would agree that the fish of my homeland is not unpleasant.
speak;Larachel;Yes.|However it does not compare with that of my home, Rausten.
speak;Innes;Is that so?|I know not what fish your country has to offer, but I have a hard time imagining they could be that much tastier than our own.
speak;Larachel;Your doubt is not surprising.|Once this war is over, you must come and visit Rausten.|I think it best if you try a wide variety of our fish for yourself.

speak;Innes;That's a good idea.|I will most certainly do so.|And perhaps you have not tasted all the fish Frelia has to offer.|To be sure, you should visit again.|Perhaps a culinary exchange is in order.|It may be that you change your opinion.
speak;Larachel;We'll see.|Very well, I accept your invitation.|I will visit your country once more and taste your national dishes.
speak;Innes;Are you sure you're supposed to be here?|I wonder if you're truly here with the permission of your superiors.
speak;Larachel;Of-of course I am!|What gives you the right to speak to me in such a manner?
speak;Innes;Well, I have heard a bit about your wild behavior...
speak;Larachel;H-how rude you are!|If I were not a holy woman, I would beat you senseless.

speak;Innes;How savage YOU are.|Perhaps you could learn self-control by observing Frelia's pegasus knights.|Yes, there's something I'd like to show you.|When the Frelia's pegasi gather in Walles Forest...|It's a spectacle of such beauty...
speak;Larachel;If it is beauty you seek, then Rausten is second to none.|Do you know of Rausten's lofty peak Mount Mimir.|I pity those who die without having gazed upon its breathtaking beauty.
speak;Innes;If you recommend it so highly, then yes, I would indeed like to see it.
speak;Larachel;Yes.|That would be splendid indeed.|But there are many more equally beautiful places in Rausten.
speak;Innes;Then perhaps you should tell me about them for future reference.|And in return, I shall take time to tell you about the beautiful places in my kingdom.
speak;Larachel;Yes, I would love to hear more.
speak;Innes;The Theocracy of Rausten certainly sounds like a spectacular land.
speak;Larachel;As does Frelia, much more than I imagined it would.|And yet...
speak;Innes;You mean to ask which is the more spectacular?|Is that it?
speak;Larachel;What?|That's no question at all!|Rausten is clearly superior in every way.
speak;Innes;I expected you would say so.|But what of the truth?|Your opinion is subjective, is it not?
speak;Larachel;Well...um...|All opinions are subjective, but I'm sure an objective evaluation would yield the same result.
speak;Innes;To prove that, we will need some fair and impartial third in our discussion.
speak;Larachel;Indeed!|And I have a splendid idea.|Let the pair from Renais judge.|Surely Ephraim and Eirika can come to a proper decision.
speak;Innes;Of course.|I agree completely.|I think I should remind the two of all the wonder Frelia holds.

speak;Larachel;Then it's decided.|They will visit both of our homes, and we'll show them such splendor as to leave them breathless.|Invitations to tour our two nations will surely have them overjoyed.
speak;Larachel;It would be natural.|Very well then.|Let us deal with this evil and take those two home with us.|First and foremost, it is a competition to see whose land is more magnificent!
speak;Innes;I can see this whole affair has you very enthralled.|I cannot say where this little competition will lead us...|But I am more than happy to go up against you.
speak;Larachel;Don't blame me if you regret our contest later, though.|You may be composed before others, but you'll surely be lonely on your own.
speak;Innes;Be warned yourself.|Your words here may prove embarrassing to you later.
speak;Larachel;It's not a problem.|This is just another contest in the name of all that is holy and true.
